name: The Story Behind the Data: Communicating in a World of Big Data
description: This course examines theory and offers practice in analyzing, interpreting, and communicating data in an understandable and engaging manner. The course explores the growing relevance and allure of Data, and Big Data. Students will learn to interpret and use raw data to "tell a story through the numbers" by creating infographics, writing informative articles from their own data mining, and presenting further findings at the end of the semester. The course draws on a range of theorists and research/data experts including Arvind Sathi, Kenneth Cukier, Viktor Mayer-Schonberger, and Eric Siegel.
